Package org.openlca.core.math

Class CalculationSetup

java.lang.Object
org.openlca.core.math.CalculationSetup
public class CalculationSetup extends Object
A setup for a product system calculation.

  • Field Details

    • productSystem

      public final ProductSystem productSystem

    • impactMethod

      public ImpactMethodDescriptor impactMethod

    • withCosts

      public boolean withCosts

    • withRegionalization

      public boolean withRegionalization
      Indicates whether a regionalized result should be calculated or not. If this is set to true, the intervention matrix is indexed by (elementary flow, location) - pairs instead of just elementary flows. The LCI result then contains results for these pairs which can be then used in regionalized impact assessments.

    • withUncertainties

      public boolean withUncertainties
      Indicates whether the calculation matrices should be created with associated uncertainty distributions. Typically, this is only required for running Monte Carlo simulations.

    • nwSet

      public NwSetDescriptor nwSet

    • allocationMethod

      public AllocationMethod allocationMethod

    • parameterRedefs

      public final List<ParameterRedef> parameterRedefs

    • numberOfRuns

      public int numberOfRuns
      Only valid for Monte Carlo Simulations (also, withUncertainties needs to be true in this case).

  • Constructor Details

    • CalculationSetup

      public CalculationSetup​(ProductSystem system)
      Creates a new calculation setup for the given type and product system. It does not add the parameter redefinitions of the product system to this setup. Thus, you need to do this in a separate step.

  • Method Details

    • setUnit

      public void setUnit​(Unit unit)
      Optionally set another unit for the calculation than the one defined in the product system.

    • getUnit

      public Unit getUnit()
      Get the unit of the quantitative reference of the product system. By default this is the reference unit of the underlying product system.

    • setFlowPropertyFactor

      public void setFlowPropertyFactor​(FlowPropertyFactor flowPropertyFactor)
      Optionally set another flow property factor for the calculation than the one defined in the product system.

    • getFlowPropertyFactor

      public FlowPropertyFactor getFlowPropertyFactor()

    • setAmount

      public void setAmount​(double amount)
      Optionally set another target amount for the calculation than the one defined in the product system.

    • getAmount

      public double getAmount()
      Get the target amount in the unit of this calculation setup.

    • getDemandValue

      public double getDemandValue()
      Get the value for the demand vector for the quantitative reference defined by this calculation setup. Note that this value is negative for waste treatment systems and that it is given in the reference unit of the reference flow.
